name: FakeLis Extension
description: Example of an openldr extension for FakeLis
author: APHL
readme:
# React Developer Tools
The React Developer Tools extension helps you inspect React component hierarchies in the browser.

## Usage
1. Install the extension
2. Open your browser's DevTools
3. Navigate to the "Components" or "Profiler" tab
4. Start inspecting your React application!

## Requirements
- React 16.8+
- Modern browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge)

## Extension Settings
This extension contributes the following settings:
* `reactDevTools.showInlineWarnings`: Enable/disable inline warnings
* `reactDevTools.theme`: Set the DevTools theme (auto/light/dark)

## Known Issues
See the [GitHub issues](https://github.com/facebook/react-devtools/issues) for known problems.

## Release Notes
### 4.28.5
- Fixed issue with Suspense boundaries
- Improved performance for large component trees
- Added support for React 18.3 features
### 4.28.0
- Added support for React Server Components
- Improved hook inspection UI
- Bug fixes and stability improvements
## More Information
* [Documentation](https://react.dev/learn/react-developer-tools)
* [Report Issues](https://github.com/facebook/react-devtools/issues)
* [Changelog](https://github.com/facebook/react-devtools/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)

---

**Enjoy!**

changelog:
# Change Log
## [4.28.5] - 2024-12-10
### Fixed
- Resolved crash when inspecting Suspense boundaries
- Fixed memory leak in profiler
- Improved error handling for malformed components
### Changed
- Performance improvements for large trees (1000+ components)
## [4.28.0] - 2024-11-15
### Added
- Support for React Server Components
- New hook inspection panel
- Enhanced profiler with flame graphs
### Fixed
- Various stability improvements
- Better TypeScript support
## [4.27.0] - 2024-10-20
### Added
- React 18.3 compatibility
- Improved accessibility features
### Changed
- UI refinements and polish
- Updated dependencies
